meanings.definition: The act or state of continuing.
meanings.sent1: Her continuance in the dance class brought her great joy.
meanings.sent2: The continuance of the rain made the fields lush and green.
meanings.sent3: The continuance of the joke had everyone laughing for hours.
meanings.sent4: His continuance in the race was like a steady river flowing towards the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The continuance of the music filled the room with a sense of peace.

meanings.definition: The period of time during which something continues.
meanings.sent1: The continuance of the meeting lasted longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: During the continuance of winter, the days grew shorter.
meanings.sent3: The continuance of the movie had the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: The continuance of the storm brought heavy winds and rain.
meanings.sent5: The continuance of the project extended into the following week.

meanings.definition: The state of remaining in existence or operation.
meanings.sent1: The continuance of the old tradition pleased the community.
meanings.sent2: The continuance of the power outage caused inconvenience for many.
meanings.sent3: The continuance of the rumor spread like wildfire.
meanings.sent4: The continuance of the engine's hum signaled that all was well.
meanings.sent5: The continuance of the business during tough times showed resilience.
